111.content: Who's side are you on anyway?
111.title: CHoose your side.

1111.content:
Sergeant Anderson
Training: Grenadier
Armed: Car15, Colt .45
Attachments: Red-Dot scope, M203
Attachment: Company R, Platoon C, Squad 2
History: Anderson grew up in a stable home with a long history in the armed forces, His father was a Navy Captain and his mother was and Air Force Pilot. He moved around a lot when he was younger do to his parents being transferred to different stations. Once his Father retired things became more secure. He lived on and air base till he was 17, when his mother was killed during a training accident. Him and his father moved off base to a three bedroom house in a gated comity where he finished his schooling and then enlisted in the Marine Corp. Now 34 he is in charge of Squad two.
1111.title: Sergeant Anderson, James A.

11112.content:
Amazing how a TV show can screw up your whole life.
Danny O'Shea grinned wistfully as he gazed at the squat vessel that bobbed next to the dock. He folded his hairy arms just above his ample belly, thinking back to his young carefree days in the early '60s. McHale's Navy. My God, how he loved that show. Loved it? He was obsessed with it. To the point it made him join the Navy right out of high school. Naturally, the Navy didn't have PT boats at that time. But they did have river patrol boats, and he served on a few of them in Vietnam. Those missions earned him two Silver Stars an two Purple Hearts, the latter he could have done without. Getting shot sucked! After 25 years in the Navy, he retired a Master Chief Petty Officer, and decided to build his own PT boat. And yes, he called it PT 73, after the boat Commander McHale and Ensign Parker and their crew of misfits sailed on in his favorite show. He toured all over Florida with it, giving people the history of PT boats and how important they were during World War II.

He never imagined his little floating museum would be used in a real war.

But what could he do? Sit on the sidelines while a rejuvenated Russia invaded his country? New York, Washington, Philadelphia and Charleston lay in ruin. Russian tank and infantry divisions pushed further south each day. The Red Navy roamed freely up and down the Florida coast, bombarding whatever city they wished.

Well that's about to change, you pinko bastards.

Would it really? He, his daughter and his two nephews had turned the 73 into an actual ship of war. The six .50 caliber machine guns worked. They also added a pair of M-60 light machine guns, a 75mm recoilless rifle and a captured Russian AGS-17 grenade launcher.

Oh yeah. There were also the two homemade torpedoes they had built. God only knew if they would work.

O'Shea shook his head. This is suicide.

But what choice did he have? That Kynda-class cruiser had been hammering Miami for days. Someone had to stop it, and it looked like that someone was him, his family, and their pals.

O'Shea chuckled to himself. Ernest Borgnine, you're going to be the death of me.
11112.title: O'Shea

choices: Hunting the PT boat in the swamps
It comes back for another attack
111122.content:
Andreovich was watching as his cruiser launched salvo after salvo of missiles into American soil. The sailor sympathized with those on the receiving end of the bombardment. When the Americans attacked Russia, he'd been in that position too many times. Overriding his sympathy was his satisfaction at being on the cutting edge of the blade that would sever Florida from the rest of the Unites States. In his childhood among the factories, Florida had been a land where gross excess ruled. It had disgusted him to no end. Now, Andreovich was planning to be among the men who fired the missiles at the resorts where the U.S. army made their camps.
Andreovich saw some movement out of the corner of his eye. A small boat streaked towards his behemoth. Having drilled on every possible boat that the Americans could field, the sailor was an expert in naval vessels of the enemy. This one was a relic. But the machine guns and, could that possibly be, a grenade launcher!-could still kill. He was shocked that the radar hadn't seen it. But the whirr of motors nearby told him otherwise. Two of the smaller cannons were rotating towards the oncoming PT boat.
"Dammit not fast enough." he said, looking worriedly at the approaching boat. He swore as two torpedoes jumped out of the boat's launchers and swiftly cut through the water towards the Kynda-class. One struck right under his feet, but bounced harmlessly off. A dud. The other one seemed to be having steering problems. It swerved wildly before finally striking the bow. This one worked fine, blowing a hole in the ship. But, Andreovich noted proudly, not big enough to seriously damage the cruiser. The guns opened up on the PT boat with a deafening roar. Andreovich manned his own weapon, a 50. Cal with a protective armor shield around it. Water jumped up on all sides of the smaller vessel, but none were hits. It raked the Russian boat with its own fire. Part of the deck next to him exploded from a grenade.
"Probably for me," he whispered while pouring fire onto the boat. Finally, some of his shots hit home. A small fire erupted in the rear of the boat and oil slicked over the water. It turned to run back to the swamps.
"Andreovich! Come on, we're going after that thing!" Andreovich's commander hollered at him. Another sailor rushed to take his gun position. Andreovich sprinted for one of the hovercraft landing vehicles the ship had been outfitted with. A squad of marines sat in the troop compartment. They saluted as he passed into the cockpit. Dmitri, his co-pilot was already ready.
"Shall we pursue him, Andreovich?" Dmitri asked happily. His small coastal village had burned during the American offensive. Along with his family.
"Let's get him." The fans powered up and the craft glided out onto the open waters.
111122.title: Russian POV

choices: The PT Boat is hit and capsizes in the swamp
1111222.content:
After steering the hovercraft a few hundred feet to follow the smaller vessel, the driver told everyone to buckle up as he gunned the throttle. The floating troop carrier's stern just scraped the water surface as the three Kuznetsov engines powered up to maximum speed, driving them to a speed of 55 knots. Soon, their adversary was within visual.
"Lock and load, men. Let's get that svoloch!" Andreovich yelled over the roar of the engines.
"Shall we put a few thirty-millimeters over their heads?" asked Dmitri.
"Ha! Good one. See to it that that happens, Dmitri. Use the first Plamya on the starboard side, you'll get a good shot from there!"
Dmitri gave a nod as he unstrapped his safety harness and climbed into the grenade-launcher turret. Several seconds later, he fired off three rounds as the entire five-hundred ton mass of the Zubr-class LCAC shook with ferocity. Andreovich watched his friend's shots land near the boat, but not close enough to set something off. He called for Dmitri to fire more to the left, and he did.
1111222.title: It comes back for another attack

1112.content:
[Orientation, bare with me on this]

"My name is Feliks Vitaly, I am a 17 year old serving in the Russian Army. I had just gotten off of the plane, and put my boots on American soil for the first time. I had always wanted to go to Seattle, specifically for the Space Needle, but it was destroyed in a bombing run before the invasion."

Feliks walked off of the runway at Seattle-Tacoma International Airport, he observed the destruction to the terminal and the still smoking city in the background. He made his way to a forming parade, and stood with his battalion. The commander of the battalion laid down the rules and procedures of the base to the fresh recruits, before dismissing them, and speaking to the company leaders, who then went on to speaking to the platoon leaders.

Although he was new, Private Vitaly had experienced the worst of the war. He grew up in a war-torn village that the invading NATO forces had occupied, and he witnessed some horrid sights of combat at a young age. Once the Russian Army pushed NATO out of the motherland, Feliks was exposed to propaganda, showing the NATO countries to be backwards, and wrong, showing them to have the intent of mass murder and rape. Like many others, Feliks developed a hatred towards the invaders, but the war in Europe came to an end as he joined.

The Russian Army had captured Poland and surrounded Berlin. NATO then looked for peace, but the war came at a cost. A limited exchange of nuclear weapons had hit Russia, America and other European countries. EU and NATO had disbanded, leaving a lot of countries fending for themselves. The only countries that managed to survive the onslaught and protect their major cities, was the US and Russia.

On the 3rd of July, the Russian air force launched a costly air raid against Seattle and military installations near it. Once the raid was complete, Russian VDV troops parachuted into Seattle, and with intense skirmishes, pushed the US troops out of Seattle and set up a proving ground for the invasion. Feliks arrived the next day.

Please, if you want to add to this scenario, send me a message first, outlining what you want to add. I know this seems a little far fetched, but that doesn't really matter, I just wanted to explain a few things.
1112.title: Russia

choices: He tells him to back down once more
11121.content:
Within a week, the Russians had secured the entire city, but not the people. Feliks' platoon was out on the streets of downtown Seattle. There had been reports of a major protest near an occupied shop, one of the designated points for the locals to receive their rations. The people were demanding that the Russians leave, and threw rocks and occasionally, ones who managed to sneak a firearm past the door to door inspections, would open fire at the soldiers.

Private Vitaly aimed his AK-12 to the floor, and had in on safety as him and his patrol moved forwards to the rioting mess that was downtown Seattle. Behind them was one of the many newly arrived GAZ Vodniks, but it was halted by the swarm of people blocking the roads. One of the protesters, armed with a metal pole stared Feliks down, who was already overwhelmed with intense anxiety. They locked eyes, and the man started taunting him, as he started to walk over to him.

He switched his rifle off of safety, and raised it.
"Don't come any close, I will shoot!" Feliks threatened with shaky hands.
"C'mon then you piece of shit, shoot me!" the man said back as he lifted his chin and walked faster.
"Shoot him, Vitaly" the squad leader said with a chillingly calm tone.

With a racing heart, Vitaly put his finger on the trigger and looked down the iron sights of his rifle...
11121.title: Continue with this Scenario

choices: Feliks makes a run for it
111211.content:
Time seemed to slow down, to Feliks, all that was in motion was him and the man coming to him. The man looked to be 30, he had a cap on and he was a giant, could most likely kill a man with one punch. With an exhale, he pulled the trigger, a single round hitting the man in the heart. He fell to the floor, and Vitaly lowered his rifle. He looked over to the Sergeant beside him, who pulled a cigarette from his mouth, and disposed of it on the floor.

After a few startled screams, the sound of silence made the soldiers uneasy. Pushing through the static crowd, came a women, she was in her forties, and she wept. The women got onto her knees, beside the man who Feliks shot. She put her arms underneath him, and held him up to her, she hugged him and cried. Feliks saw his face, and realised that he was probably younger than.

"He was 19! You mother fucker!" She yelled with tears running down her face. Feliks felt sick, he looked on the floor beside the young man and didn't see the pole anywhere. Then it occurred to him, he was just trying to get through the line and go home. The propaganda had warped him.

The Rules of Engagement said that if you feel threatened, you can engage anybody within 200 metres of you...

The crowd got rowdy again and started to walk over to the soldiers, this time they were armed, and Feliks was sure of it. The Sergeant tapped Feliks on his shoulder and looked behind him, to the other soldiers.
"It's a free fire zone" he said in Russian, without breaking a sweat.

The KPVT machine gun on the Vodnik opened fire, hitting the crowd with a hailstorm of 14.5MM rounds. Vitaly sunk back in his squad as they advanced, and started to fire.
Feliks felt nauseated as he watched the massacre unfold. He lent against the wall and started to cry, closing his eyes and pretending that what just occurred, never happened. A hand grabbed onto his shoulder, and turned him around.

"Are you a bitch? Pull your head in!" A squad member said to him.
The screams stopped, and Vitaly looked over to what was once a crowd of people. The gunpowder in the air made it hard, but he could see the bodies all over the floor.
Feliks knew he needed to shape up if he wanted to survive this war, and if the Squad Leader saw him like this, he would be beaten to a pulp. He realised that he wasn't cut out for all of this.
111211.title: He pulls the trigger

121.content:
It would be nice to say that the attack came without warning, but it didn’t. The government knew of the threat, but the inept administration that was in charge thought they could negotiate. Unknown to all but a few was that the Islamic extremist known as the Taliban had taken over the Mexican government seven years ago. All the bloodshed that had been going on across the border had been the Taliban eliminating the various drug cartels struggling to hold on to their way of life. President Obama had secretly set up a covert operation through the BATF called Operation Runner to arm the cartels against the Mexican Taliban.
The Taliban has just eliminated the last of cartels and are pouring across the border into the USA. The Border Patrol is not informed or armed well enough to stop them. The Government is still trying to keep it secret, but you know about it. You’ve been monitoring encrypted satellite transmissions and other sources for years. People have accused you of being paranoid and crazy, but who’s laughing now. You’ve stockpiled a rather large supply of weapons, ammo, fuel, vehicles, and food. You originally thought you would be fighting off a zombie apocalypse, or space aliens but the Taliban will do. You have banded together with some likeminded neighbors to defend your town. “Time to kill us some wet back rag heads”, you say while racking your shotgun. You then load several other weapons onto your homemade armored truck.
The Taliban have come across all along the border from California to Texas. You live in..............

14121.content:
You are John Lowry. You are a 6'2, incredibly ripped man with no military history. You live in small Florida town, with your wife. You have no children, and a beautiful wife. You are 26 and in the prime of your life, good career, good relationship, steady income, when all of a sudden America and Great Britain start getting into some heated arguments. You're sense of nationalism kicks in, and sooner or later you find yourself hating the Brits.

You were resting on the couch with your wife, watching TV one day when a Breakin News alert came on.

"Greetings, I am Cathy Williams with local 6 news. We have just gotten word that the UK has invaded Florida. If you live in Florida, you are currently in a militarized war zone, and we suggest you evacuate the state." The tv then went static as you turned to your wife. You both shared the same look of pure terror and disbelief. Then you heard the machinery.

You look outside your window to see Tanks upon tanks rolling down the streets. You see officers in the military breaking into the houses all around you as you hear one on your own door.
14121.title: America's

141211.content:
You open the door with your baseball bat in hand, to a British officer. "Hello there, would you and your wife mind following me?" He said in his heavily accented voice. You turn to him and say "I'll pass." Raising your bat over your head. He then pulls out a pistol and says "Let me rephrase that. Come with me." You then follow his order and grab your wife by her arm and follow him out the door and to a bus like vehicle with no seats, and about thirty other people standing in it.

You are then all drove to the coast, where they dock you and seemingly infinite amounts of busses into huge cargo ships. You are standing in a crowded, huge room for about a week before you reach the dock you are intended to reach. They end up separating you and your wife as they unload you into facilities where they have constant videos on loops being played.

A woman who has a wide grin appears on the screen, saying in a British accent "welcome to hub #43. You are now property of the British empire and being prepared to be enslaved and sold to the people of our great country as slaves." You then realize the situation you are set in as they process the line you are in. You make your way to the front of the line, and when you reach it a shot is injected to your arm and you pass out.

When you wake up you feel something strange as you look in your rust to see a chip of some sort lodged inside of you. A voice then yells "Get ready for auction!" And you look around you to see other Americans waking up in a cell with you. The metal door then opens as a man grabs a chain which has all of you attached to it and starts walking outside.

You are blinded by the light as you step outside into what appears to be a city square in the center of London. You then watch how the auction works as there is a crowd of people ready to take part in this retelling of history. You then watch a man unmatched from the chain and brought up on the stage as the bids start coming in.

"Fifty!" "Sixty!" "Three hundred!" You hear yelled as the auctioneer hits his gavel. You then test your eyes, and daydream, before you finally realize that it is you being taken up to the stage. You glare into the audience, as people whisper to each other. The auctioneer starts off the bidding and you hear quite large sums being yelled.

"Eight Hundred!" You hear. "One Thousand!" "Two thousand!" "Ten thousand!" You hear the crowd going silent. It stays this way for ten seconds before the auctioneer hits his hammer and yells "Sold!" You are grabbed by your hands and taken into the audience to your new owner as you see
141211.title: You grab a baseball bat

You place your arms on the top and pull yourself up, but you feel a hand grab you from the other side.

"Get down this instant you bloody moron!" You hear the voice say, tugging at your leg. With a newly found level of effort you

1511121.content:
(Authors Note: He was discharged not court-martial. Sorry Late night and long time away. Should have more time to write since I got discharged. Now to the story)

John was on closing up shop at Jackson Military, Gun, and Supply for the day. It was Sunday and he always closed early so he could go to the gym and try to rebuild his strength. The accident had been avoidable but Major Chalmers had not listened about the explosives, that had been in storage in the ammo dump since the Carter administration getting wet when the sub-basement of the dump had flooded, had become highly unstable. But Chalmers had not listened to him or the second in command. Chalmers ordered John and lieutenant O'Hara to clean out the sub-basement, it did not end well. He and O'Hara were carefully moving the crates out of the main room. they were almost done, as they came back in to the main room the last crate which had been jarred close to the edge of the rack fell. O'Hara was in front and off to the side of the side of John, it was the last thing he saw before the create hit the ground and discharge itself. Now O'Hara, may she rest in peace, was dead a piece of the create had pierced her neck. Josh awoke in the infirmary and had been later discharged out of the guard and had bought part ownership in his brother's vintage military and gun supply shop. Now he was off to physical training ad then to his brother's home for supper.

1521.content:
The Canadian military intervention is very much resented and local resistance is building up.
The action is mainly set...
1521.title: Under Canadian military occupation

choices: Steal the truck but let the soldiers go.
Take the truck and kidnap the  soldiers.
15211.content:
2:30 pm, on a sunny but cool October day in rural Vermont… a Canadian Armed Forces transport truck was riding through the countryside, headed for the nearest town, when it ran into an ambush.

The roadblock looked genuine enough, the patrol car and the trooper uniforms used in the operation having been “liberated” from a State Police station the night before.

Canadian troops were under strict orders to fully cooperate with local law enforcement. And so, when ordered to stop and submit himself and his driver to an ID check, the NCO in charge of the two-men detail felt that he had no choice but to comply. Soon he and his colleague were climbing down from the cabin.

“I’m Corporal Martin Couture and that’s Private Marc Trudel.” The Corporal spoke English with a heavy French-Canadian accent. “We’re from Camp Triquet and we’re going to the supply depot in St.Albans to pick up some foodstuff for our unit.”

At this point, the fake cops drew their guns and ordered the soldiers to stick’em up – which they did, as they suddenly saw themselves surrounded by half a dozen types wearing hoods and pointing rifles at them.

What's the Resistancee plan?
15211.title: The Ambush

choices: the truck is headed for the supply depot.
the truck is headed for the old National Guard armory
152112.content:
It was 3 pm and the transport truck was riding into St.Albans, half an hour late. In principle, it was running empty. In reality, it was a Trojan horse for a raiding party of the American resistance.

In the cab, two young patriotic Americans dressed in Canadian uniforms: Paul Miller, posing as the private, who sat behind the wheel, and Tom Freeman, posing as the corporal, who rode shotgun. Paul was a local boy of old farmer stock, and Tom a graduate student in computing sciences at the University of Vermont in Burlington.

In addition to Miller and Freeman, the truck carried a team of six freedom fighters, hidden in the back. Their commanding officer was Dave Marcotte, a native Vermonter and a former Navy Seal. Except for Freeman, who was a civilian through and through, all of those men had, at a moment or another, received military training, either in the regular armed forces or in the late Vermont National Guard, now disbanded.
152112.title: The Trojan Horse

choices: The Canadian soldier follows up on the suggestion and climbs into the truck.
The Canadian soldier says "what the heck?" and buzzes the truck in.
1521122.content:
Soon they reached their destination – the old National Guard armory now used as a munitions depot by the Canadians.

Freeman got off the truck and approached the lone soldier on duty at the gate. “Hi! I’m Caporal Martin Couture.” His impression of a French Canadian accent was much too theatrical to be credible. Fortunately, the guard was no Quebecker, but an Anglo from Alberta. So he didn’t really care. He was too busy checking on the paperwork that the bogus corporal had handed over to him on a clipboard

“But this is an order for foodstuff and clothing!” the young soldier finally said. “You’re at the wrong place. This is an arms and munitions depot…”

“No! No! Not dat piece of paper! dee oder one! DIS ONE!”

“What piece of paper? I don’t understand...”

“Dis piece of paper, de one about de crates of grenades, tree of dose dat we got and we don’t need it. I’m bringing it here.”

The young soldier, also a corporal, looked genuinely puzzled.

“It’s in the back, as I said. Go see and check for yourself.”
1521122.title: At the gates of the old Armory

choices: They draw the attention of a suspicous guard and they must abort the mission.
They capture the arms depot in one fell swoop.
15211221.content:
A second or two after the corporal had disappeared into the truck, there was some noise, like a brief scuffle. And then nothing.

Five minutes elapsed until, finally, the tarpaulin curtain opened and a guy dressed as a Canadian soldier jumped out of the truck. That was Matt Dawson, one of Marcotte’s men.

“How do I look?” he asked, while adjusting his new beret, which had the Logistics Branch’s badge pinned on it.

“You look great! “But what about the former owner of this splendid outfit?…”

“He’s in dreamland,” Dawson replied with a grin.

And then, on a more urgent and serious tone, he added: “Get back in the cab and I’ll let you in. We all meet in the arms depot in exactly two minutes and a half. Check your watch.”
15211221.title: So far, so good...

choices: they move on to occupy the rest of the compound.
they remain in the arm depot
152112212.content:
Inside of the truck, tension was mounting.

The only one who didn’t seem to feel it was Dave Marcotte himself. He knew that he had a couple of invaluable key assets in his pocket.

For one thing, as former guardsmen and local military enthusiasts, he and most of his men knew the place inside out. There was also the two-month long 24/7 intense surveillance to which they had subjected the compound itself and its phone communications. As a result, there’s practically nothing that he didn’t know about the Canadian troops stationed there and their schedules and routines.

In the event, all went exactly as planned. As they arrived at the armory, Miller and Freeman found Dawson waiting for them. They got off their vehicle and then, together with him, they went through the door into the armory. There they found the clerks on duty – all four of them – immersed in a card game. Basically, all that they had to do was to draw their guns and the place was theirs, in one fell swoop.
152112212.title: They move on the arms depot

choices: in the cellar of an isolated farmhouse
in the cellar of a maple sugar factory
1521122121.content:
Next Marcotte and Dawson went through the rest of the building. As far as moping up operations go, that one was more like a joke. They caught the sergeant at his work station, playing video games, and then they captured the young commanding officer – a female captain - just as she was coming out of her washroom. That was the full extent of it.

The captain… the sergeant… the corporal…the four clerks… Everyone who supposed to be there was accounted for.

In the meantime, in the Resistance’s lair, some fifteen miles from St.Albans…
1521122121.title: The Moping Up Operation

choices: The partisans are looking for documents about the Canadian occupation.
The partisans have started loading a couple of trucks with weapons and ammo.
15211221211.content:
The task on keeping watch on the two Canadians taken prisoner a little earlier on their way to St.Albans had fallen on the shoulders of the Carson brothers, Pete and Bud. Pete’s shoulders were very large – hence his nickname of Big Pete, whereas those of his kid brother were much smaller.

Neither guy was particularly bright, especially Big Pete, and thus Marcotte had judged it advisable not to include the pair in his raiding party. On the other hand, he had absolutely no objection to having those dimwits entrusted with the job of guarding a couple of Canuck soldiers in their long underwear all tied up in their great-grandfather’s barn.

What Marcotte had not foreseen is that, at 3 p.m., the two brothers would lock the barn to go to the house for half an hour and watch a rerun of their favorite program - America’s Funniest Home Videos - on one of the local channels…

Meanwhile, in the old armory in St.Albans…
15211221211.title: America's Funniest Home Videos
